intro: Cienfuegosia benthamii, commonly known as the Bentham's cienfuegosia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
